subject: p19565388
History: Suspicious lung consolidation with VAP in a-year-old woman.
Findings: Increased retrocardiac density and the left lower lung opacity, which likely represents a combination of atelectasis and/or consolidation has minimally worsened since. On single frontal view, if any of this represents infection cannot be ruled out and needs further clinical correlation. Right lung is clear. A right internal jugular line sheath ends at upper SVC. Heart size is mild-to-moderately enlarged and unchanged. Mediastinal and hilar contours are unremarkable.
